longDescription: Organically grown and packed with antioxidants, Organic Jamun is a summer fruit known for its natural ability to support blood sugar management and digestion. Its rich purple hue and tangy flavor make it a delightful seasonal treat, favored for its health benefits and traditional medicinal uses.
Rich in antioxidants and known for its benefits in managing blood sugar levels, Jamun is a nutrient-packed seasonal fruit widely enjoyed in India during summer.

Fresh Indian Blueberries. Blueberries are rich in antioxidants that help fight inflammation and support heart health. They also boost brain function and improve memory.
Yelakki (Elaichi) bananas are small, sweet, and aromatic, rich in potassium, vitamin C, and fiber. They support digestion and are commonly used in Indian sweets and snacks.
A fragrant herb rich in vitamins A, C, and K, parsley adds a refreshing zest to any dish. Grown hydroponically, it's pesticide-free and packed with natural flavor.
This crisp, nutrient-rich lettuce is a staple in Caesar salads and wraps. Grown in a controlled hydroponic setup, it stays fresh, crunchy, and chemical-free.
Loaded with antioxidants and fiber, curly kale is a superfood that boosts immunity and gut health. Hydroponically grown to preserve maximum nutrients and freshness.
Known for its bold, peppery bite, arugula elevates salads and sandwiches. Grown without soil, it’s clean, vibrant, and bursting with flavor.
This frilly green lettuce is tender and mild, perfect for gourmet salads. Its hydroponic origin ensures pristine leaves and consistent taste.
Also known as Bok Choy, this Asian green is rich in calcium and perfect for stir-fries. Grown hydroponically for a clean, crunchy, and nutritious experience.
With its soft texture and subtle sweetness, red oak leaf lettuce adds elegance to meals. Hydroponic cultivation guarantees freshness and zero contaminants.
Delicately soft and buttery in texture, this lettuce is a chef’s favorite. It's grown without pesticides in a clean hydroponic environment for safety and taste.
A traditional leafy green rich in iron and antioxidants, great for boosting blood health. Grown hydroponically, it’s clean, vibrant, and ready to cook.
An aromatic herb that enhances everything from roasted veggies to salads. Hydroponically grown rosemary is intensely flavorful and free from harmful residues.
Large, hearty spinach leaves ideal for cooking and smoothies, rich in iron and vitamins. Grown in clean water channels, it’s fresh and pesticide-free.
Tender and nutrient-dense, baby spinach is perfect for salads and soups. Hydroponically grown for freshness, safety, and year-round availability.
A curated mix of hydroponic salad greens, ready to eat fresh from the box. Perfect for quick, healthy meals with a burst of color and crunch.
This papaya is organically grown without synthetic fertilizers or harmful pesticides, ensuring natural purity. Rich in enzymes and nutrients, it's a healthy, chemical-free choice for your daily diet.
Sweet, crunchy mini peppers perfect for snacking or dipping. Grown in a hydroponic setup, they’re clean, flavorful, and high in vitamin C.

Onions are a versatile kitchen staple, rich in antioxidants and compounds that support heart health and blood sugar regulation. Their pungent flavor enhances a variety of dishes, from curries to salads.
White onions have a milder, sweeter flavor compared to regular onions. They are rich in antioxidants and may help reduce inflammation, support heart health, and improve digestion.
Bananas are a convenient, energy-boosting fruit packed with potassium, vitamin B6, and fiber. They support heart health, aid digestion, and help regulate blood sugar levels.
Bottle gourd is a hydrating vegetable low in calories and rich in vitamin C and zinc. It supports digestion, promotes skin health, and is beneficial for weight management.
Spinach is a nutrient-dense leafy green, high in vitamins A, C, and K, as well as iron and folate. It supports eye health, boosts immunity, and contributes to bone strength.

shortDescription: 1 box (approx 250 gm) of 4 pieces, imported from Peru
longDescription: Kiwi is a tangy-sweet fruit rich in vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants. It aids digestion, supports heart health, and boosts the immune system.
Tomatoes are juicy fruits rich in lycopene, vitamin C, and potassium. They support heart health, reduce inflammation, and are versatile in various culinary dishes.
White cucumbers are crisp and hydrating, low in calories, and high in water content. They aid in digestion and are ideal for salads and cooling dishes.
Cluster beans are fiber-rich legumes that support digestion and help regulate blood sugar levels. They are low in calories and beneficial for heart health.
Lady finger is a green vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins C and K, and antioxidants. It supports digestive health and may help regulate blood sugar levels.
Ridge gourd is a low-calorie vegetable high in dietary fiber, vitamin C, and iron. It aids in digestion, supports weight loss, and helps in detoxification.
Bitter gourd is known for its distinct bitter taste and is rich in antioxidants and polyphenols. It supports blood sugar regulation and boosts immune health.
Sponge gourd is a light, nutritious vegetable rich in vitamins A and C, and dietary fiber. It supports digestion and helps in detoxifying the body.
Green capsicum is a crunchy vegetable rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. It supports immune health and adds flavor to a variety of dishes.
Green chillies are spicy peppers rich in capsaicin, which boosts metabolism and aids digestion. They are also high in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Potatoes are starchy tubers rich in carbohydrates, vitamin C, and potassium. They provide energy and are versatile in various culinary preparations.
Garlic is a pungent bulb known for its medicinal properties. It supports heart health, boosts immunity, and has anti-inflammatory effects.
Ginger is a spicy root with anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It aids digestion, reduces nausea, and supports immune health.
Drumsticks are nutrient-rich pods high in vitamins A and C, calcium, and iron. They support bone health, boost immunity, and aid digestion.
Cabbage is a leafy vegetable rich in vitamin K, vitamin C, and fiber. It supports digestive health, reduces inflammation, and aids in weight management.
Green peas are sweet legumes rich in protein, fiber, and vitamins A, C, and K. They support heart health, aid digestion, and help regulate blood sugar levels.
Spring onions are mild-flavored bulbs rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. They support immune health and add a fresh taste to dishes.
Fenugreek leaves are aromatic greens rich in iron, fiber, and antioxidants. They support digestion, regulate blood sugar, and enhance flavor in dishes.
Mint leaves are refreshing herbs rich in antioxidants and menthol. They aid digestion, relieve nausea, and add flavor to beverages and dishes.
Green cucumbers are hydrating vegetables high in water content and low in calories. They support digestion and are ideal for salads.
Madras cucumbers are crisp and mildly sweet, rich in water content. They aid in hydration and are commonly used in South Indian dishes.
Fresh coriander leaves are aromatic and flavorful, used to garnish and enhance curries, dals, and snacks. Rich in antioxidants and known for aiding digestion, it's a staple herb in Indian kitchens.

Cauliflower is a versatile vegetable with tightly packed white florets, perfect for curries, parathas, and stir-fries. It is high in fiber and vitamin C, making it a healthy choice for everyday cooking.
French beans are tender, crisp, and mildly sweet, used in stir-fries, sabzis, and pulao. They are a good source of fiber, folate, and vitamin K, supporting heart and bone health.
Curry leaves are fragrant and flavorful, often used in tempering for South Indian dishes. They are rich in antioxidants and iron, and known to support digestion and improve hair health.
Lemons are juicy and tangy, commonly used in Indian dishes, drinks, and pickles. They are a rich source of vitamin C and aid in hydration, digestion, and immunity.
Ivy gourd (Tindora) is a small, green vegetable used in dry sabzis and curries. It is low in calories and rich in fiber, vitamins A and C, and helps support blood sugar control.
Raw mangoes are tangy and refreshing, often used in pickles, chutneys, and summer drinks like aam panna. They are rich in vitamin C and known for their cooling and digestive properties.
Cowpea beans are tender green pods used in stir-fries and traditional curries. They are rich in protein, iron, and fiber, making them a healthy addition to vegetarian meals.
Yam (Suran) is a starchy root vegetable with a firm texture, commonly used in dry curries and festive dishes. It is rich in fiber and potassium, supporting digestion and heart health.
Snake gourd is a long, soft vegetable with a mild flavor, used in dals, sabzis, and South Indian recipes. It is rich in water content and supports hydration and digestive health.
Beetroot is a vibrant root vegetable with natural sweetness, used in salads, juices, and curries. It is high in iron and folate, supporting blood circulation and stamina.
Lemongrass is a fragrant herb used in teas, soups, and curries for its citrusy aroma. It is known for its calming properties and may help relieve cold symptoms and improve digestion.
Broccoli is a nutrient-dense vegetable with crisp green florets, used in stir-fries, salads, and bakes. It is rich in fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants that support immunity and heart health.
Red bell peppers are sweet, juicy, and colorful, great for salads, roasting, and stir-fries. They are rich in vitamin C, antioxidants, and add a crunchy, nutritious boost to meals.
Yellow bell peppers are vibrant and mildly sweet, perfect for salads, grilling, or cooking. They are high in vitamin C and support eye health and immunity.
Cherry tomatoes are small, juicy, and slightly sweet, great for salads, snacks, or pasta dishes. They are rich in lycopene and vitamin C, promoting skin and heart health.
Green zucchini is a soft, mild-flavored vegetable used in stir-fries, pasta, and bakes. Low in calories and rich in antioxidants, it's ideal for healthy and light meals.
Yellow zucchini is tender and slightly sweeter than green zucchini, used in soups, bakes, and stir-fries. It is rich in vitamin A and supports eye health and immunity.
Lalbagh mangoes are juicy and sweet with a rich flavor, perfect for eating fresh or in desserts. They are high in vitamin A and antioxidants, making them a seasonal favorite.
Badami mangoes are soft, aromatic, and fibrous, often called Karnataka’s Alphonso. They are rich in vitamins and known for their smooth texture and delightful sweetness.
Totapuri mangoes are tangy and firm, ideal for pickles, juices, and salads. Their unique shape and mildly sour taste make them popular for both raw and ripe consumption.

This premium imported avocado is creamy, nutrient-rich, and perfect for smoothies, salads, or toast. Sourced from trusted global farms, it's a wholesome addition to your diet, even if not organically grown.
